intro: Popowia cambodica var. canaensis, commonly known as the Cambodian popowia, is a rare flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forest areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
